meanings.definition: An institution for receiving, lending, exchanging, and safeguarding money.
meanings.sent1: I went to the bank to deposit my birthday money.
meanings.sent2: The bank is where people keep their savings and take out loans.
meanings.sent3: Why did the penny go to the bank? To get some interest!
meanings.sent4: Her piggy bank was a treasure trove of coins.
meanings.sent5: The bank, with its marble floors and security guards, felt like a fortress of wealth.

meanings.definition: A slope, mass, or mound of a particular substance.
meanings.sent1: The river bank was covered in colorful flowers.
meanings.sent2: She sat on the grassy bank and watched the ducks swim by.
meanings.sent3: The chocolate bank in the dessert shop looked too delicious to resist.
meanings.sent4: The snow bank at the edge of the road was higher than the car.
meanings.sent5: The sand bank by the ocean was a perfect spot for sunbathing.

meanings.definition: The land alongside or sloping down to a river or lake.
meanings.sent1: We had a picnic on the bank of the river.
meanings.sent2: The ducks waddled along the muddy bank of the pond.
meanings.sent3: The fisherman cast his line from the steep bank.
meanings.sent4: The willow trees swayed gracefully by the tranquil bank.
meanings.sent5: The children skipped stones across the calm bank of the lake.
